title: Zed player's opinion on his current state
body:
Now this is only my opinion so take it with a grain of salt.

I believe Zed is in a good spot at the moment but is perceived to be a little bit too strong which I feel stems from AP mage players who were shafted with price increases in the pre-season. This is not a problem with Zed perse but a lot of AP mages being very poor at the moment ({{champion:103}} {{champion:99}} {{champion:63}} still seem very strong) because they reach power-spikes slower and items like {{item:3157}} are far too expensive and offer much less then in earlier seasons.

The upcoming AD assassin item is also I feel is a poor idea as it may push him into the OP territory, not because of the passive really but the movement speed makes him stick to targets easier. Without this item I think he has well defined strengths and weaknesses.

His laning phase is definitely strong but it needs to be because without snowballing he isn't going to be useful later on. His teamfighting is belong average, especially into comp with lots of CC/peel and if he isn't strong his split-push is useless too which would make him a liability. What some people fail to understand is he should beat squishy mages in lane, that's normal for a 1v1 assassin against an AOE/teamfighting mage. Get a early Seekers before going Mana Regen (Frostfang is cheap and offers 100% mana regen), take Exhaust and you'll have a smoother laning phase and wait until you outscale.

If you want to beat a Zed in lane, options like {{champion:131}} {{champion:117}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:127}} do quite well against him and are stronger lategame too. Lulu only when paired with a good AD though.

**tl;dr
-> Zed is in a good spot currently.
-> Assassin item is a bad idea and will likely make him overpowered.
-> AP items suck dick at the moment apart from {{item:3001}} {{item:3027}}
-> Get early {{item:3191}} and {{summoner:3}} and play safer if you are a squishy mage. Malphite will easily 1v1 an ADC, Zed will easily 1v1 a mage. That's why you have a team.**

I've never actually played Lissandra, so take this with a grain of salt, but I assume a lot of her power over Zed comes after the laning phase is complete. As you pointed out, Lissandra can stop Zed's assassination attempts by ulting and locking him down the moment he tries something, which in a teamfight is a death sentence for someone as squishy as Zed is. On the other hand, if Zed tries to splitpush, Lissandra has the tools to engage a 5v4 teamfight for her team, allowing them to take objectives faster than Zed alone can. Lissandra could also probably go and deal with Zed's splitpushing personally assuming he's not too far ahead thanks to her cc and decent waveclear.

"What some people fail to understand is he should beat squishy mages in lane, that's normal for a 1v1 assassin against an AOE/teamfighting mage."

That may be the intent from Riot. The problem is that isn't fun at all. I'm not ok with just having to cede a lane and become weak because X champion was picked. Especially when I'm playing a champion that I picked specifically because in most cases it's capable of both farming well and getting kills when I outplay my opponent.

Zed just takes away all of that and says "no, sit there and get mediocre cs and have 0 impact in the laning phase except to spam MIA pings when I roam." Outplaying him results in being down in cs and a 0/0/0 score. It'd be different if I pick a champion that typically has a weak laning phase or is meant to farm hard and be strong later from just that (like Nasus).

Zed's laning phase is simply too oppressive vs mages. He's far too good against skillshots and pokes very hard. People often say that this is compensation for his bad team fighting later. So I say give him better team fighting later and make his laning phase less of a giant pain in everyone's ass.

His E is targetable so people claiming "infinite dashes" are very wrong. You want to beat Yasuo? Play it smart and time everything, don't all in whenever you want, he's not unfun, he's a matchup that requires the opposing player to have skill.

But that's ok, because I'm very well aware of how Yasuo works. Beating him isn't the problem. Hell I don't even have to dodge tornadoes most of the time if I don't want to, I main Morgana. None of that makes it any less of a giant pain in the ass to lane against him.

You said Yasuo is one of the most unfun laners to face, if you can beat him with ease then its not Yasuo that's unfun. I gave plenty of advice, you just took my last point and claimed it was all I said. As for me just stating your opinion was wrong, I did give supporting structure to my side of the argument and gave an actual answer rather than just saying you're wrong. Please re-think answering just because you are annoyed.
